overview: Lasting over thirteen hours, Claerbout's film shows two men engaged in a discussion against the back-drop of a neoclassical house in southern France. An act of violence is repeated and re-enacted more than seventy times over the course of the film. Dissolving the boundaries between photography and film, Claerboutâ€™s work puts into question the reassuring stillness of photography and the inevitable narrative progress of the cinematic image.  Courtesy of the artist and Micheline Szwacjer Antwerp.
title: The White House
